channel.title: [Shard] PlayerRights do not save?
channel.description:
If I edit my characters player rights, set them to anything other than zero (player) and save it, when I log in, there is no difference, when I log out, the number is reset to zero.
All other items stay saved, including items, stats and votes\ep.

item.title: [Shard] PlayerRights do not save?
item.dc:creator: @lol_space1 lol space
item.description:
@lol_space1 wrote:

Well, I’m just working out of the blue here because I skimmed through the problem, but those commands that still refuse to work, that deal with playerRights, try looking at your playersave class? Check to see if the (“character-rights”) token is correct, if you would like you can post that specific token below and I’ll check it outt.

Read full topic

item.title: [Shard] PlayerRights do not save?
item.dc:creator: @legendarykills legendarykills
item.description:
@legendarykills wrote:

AtomicInt_:

I’m pretty sure the file is within data/config

Within that file I found two items, a blank “accounts”.txt and then a “rights” folder with names of ranks.

I just added my account name to the Owner.conf and I now have Dev tag… so I’ll keep playing with this, thanks so much!

Edit: Some commands still refuse to work though, namely ones that required an exception in place of character rights.

Read full topic

item.title: [Shard] PlayerRights do not save?

item.title: [Shard] PlayerRights do not save?
item.dc:creator: @legendarykills legendarykills
item.description:
@legendarykills wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Shard uses a configuration file to determine a character’s “rights”

I’m lost and willing to learn, I can’t figure out where to go. I’ve unraveled this chord of errors and have been commenting out items not useful to me. (After this had occured, obviously :P)

Read full topic
